on reading compounds: 縄文【ジョウモン】straw-rope pattern pressed into earthenware, Jōmon period (ca. 10000-300 BCE)
縄墨【ジョウボク】standard, inked timber marking string
絞縄【コウジョウ】hangman's noose, halter, rope to hang a criminal
結縄【ケツジョウ】knotted cord or rope, quipu, quippu
kun reading compounds: 縄張り【なわばり】stretching a rope around, roping off, cordoning off, demarcation, one's turf, domain, territory, jurisdiction, sphere of influence
腰縄【こしなわ】leash, rope tied round prisoner's waists
